title: West Point cadet, 20, is found dead four days after he vanished
text:
Kade Kurita, 20, was found dead on Tuesday night

A 20-year-old West Point cadet who had been missing since Friday has been found dead.

Kade Kurita, 20, member of Class of 2021, had been missing since Friday when he failed to show for a military skills competition Friday evening.

His body was found at the West Point military post in New York Tuesday night.

Lt. Gen. Darryl Williams, 60th superintendent of the U.S. Military Academy, said in a statement Wednesday: 'We are grieving this loss and our thoughts and prayers go out to Cadet Kurita’s family and friends.'

The Military Police began their search at 1am on Sunday morning before calling on the New York State Police and the Orange County Sheriff's Department.

Helicopters, drones and K-9 units have been involved in the search.

State police dive teams were using sonar to search the Hudson River and ponds near the campus, the New York Post reported.

His body was found at the West Point military post in New York Tuesday night. Cadet Kade Kurita is pictured with actor Stephen Lang in this photo above

In addition, soldiers and state troopers were also exploring more than 6,000 acres near West Point for any clues to Kurita's whereabouts.

A M4 rifle also went missing, and West Point officials at the time reiterated that Kurita may be a danger to himself but likely not to the public.

West Point officials said he was not known to be carrying any magazines or ammunition.

The West Point Military Academy, which houses over 4,000 cadets, is considered one of the best and most prestigious officer-training military academies in the world.

According to their website, the school's mission is to 'educate, train, and inspire the Corps of Cadets so that each graduate is a commissioned leader of character committed to the values of Duty, Honor, Country and prepared for a career of professional excellence and service to the Nation as an officer in the United States Army.'
